description: This operation retrieves data related to an externally loaded Batch and its associated                  Application Input (e.g. Payroll, External Payroll, Absence).
Retrieves Employer Paid Expense Costing Defaults Criterias and their Employer Paid                  Expense Costing Defaults.
This operation retrieves data related to an External Pay Group (e.g. Pay Group expected                  to have Payroll processed on an external non-Workday system).
Retrieves External Payroll Deductions. The Get External Payroll Deductions web service                  is equivalent to the View External Payroll Deductions report in Workday.
Retrieves External Payroll Earnings. The Get External Payroll Earnings web service                  is equivalent to the View External Payroll Earnings report in Workday.
This operation retrieves data related to External Payroll Inputs (e.g. associated                  with an External Earning/Deduction).

This operation retrieves data related to Payees (e.g. Employees) that belong to an                  External Pay Group (e.g. Pay Group expected to have Payroll processed on an external                  non-Workday system).  Data returned includes Employment, Personal, Earnings and Deductions.
Retrieves Payroll Forward Accrual Options including Pay Components to Exclude from                  Forward Accrual Processing.
Retrieves Payroll Retro Costing Options including Earnings to exclude from Configurable                  Retro Costing Processing.
Return Period Schedules

Get Worker- or Position Restrictions-based costing allocations, either for specific                  criteria or for all workers or positions.  Can include only the external integration                  references or the full allocation details.

This Public Web Service Operation returns Worker Effective Change Integration System                  Instances. Users can request for set of instances to return by this operation. When                  no instances provided this Operation returns all Instances.

This background service operation will add or update external payroll document(s)                  and batch ID's into Workday. This import is asynchronous and the response will only                  be an acknowledgment or receipt.

This background service operation will add/update Application Batch(es) and External                  Payroll Input(s) into Workday. This import is asynchronous and the response will only                  be an acknowledgment or receipt.

This background service operation will add, update or delete External Payroll Result(s),                  External Payroll Result Line(s), External Payroll Run Detail(s) and Application Batch                  (which is used to uniquely identify External Payroll Run Detail(s)) into Workday.                  This import service is intended only to be invoked from an integration process. This                  import is asynchronous and the response will only be an acknowledgement or receipt.
This operation allows for the loading/updating of a Batch.
Persists Employer Paid Expense Costing Defaults Criterias and their Employer Paid                  Expense Costing Defaults.

This web service operation allows the user to do the following:                                    1 - Update Last Extract Created for External Pay Group by providing External Pay Group                  Reference, Integration System Reference, and Date Time. Also Updates Date Time for                  Additional Run for Effective Stack Sync Integrations.                                    2 - Update External Payroll Period Status by providing Pay Group Reference, Period                  Reference, and Period Status Reference. Note: Put Pay Group (Web Service) allows the                  user to add/update the full External Pay Group instance with all required details.
This operation, designed to support eligibility, gives you the ability to import third-party                  payroll actual hours worked into Workday.

Creates or updates an External Payroll Deduction. The Put External Payroll Deduction                  web service is equivalent to the create and edit External Payroll Deduction tasks                  in Workday.
Creates or updates an External Payroll Earning. The Put External Payroll Earning web                  service is equivalent to the create and edit External Payroll Earning tasks in Workday.
This operation accepts periodic employee pay data from an external partner for use                  in Payroll Interface web service APIs.
This Put web service operation will allow importing the batch errors related to global                  payroll integration event(s) into Workday.
Persists Payroll Forward Accrual Options including Pay Components to Exclude from                  Forward Accrual Processing.
Updates Payroll Retro Accounting Options including Earnings to Exclude from Configurable                  Retro Costing Processing.
This public web service operation is designed to add/update Period Schedules
This Web Service operation will create/update entries for Primary run Last Created                  Date time for Worker Effective Change Integration Systems.
